column4: Just installed Lucid, my volume control disappeared from my notification area.  How do I get it back?
Tried right-clicking and adding volume control?
In the 'Add to Panel' dialog?  Yes, "Volume Control" isn't an option there.
weird. Did you upgrade or do a clean install?
I can control the volume using System->Preferences->Sound, but obviously that's not as convenient
is volume control ticked off in System / Preferences / Start-Up Applications?
gnome-volume-control seems to be a part of gnome-media. Can you check it's status in Synaptic?
I'd suggest marking it for reinstalling
okay, I'll try that.  when I run gnome-volume-control in a console, it opens up the same window as System->Preferences-Sound
Shouldn't there just be some command I can run that would open it up?  if you edit Volume Control in Startup Programs, what command is there?
haa, that did it, lol.  thanks for your help!  I'll try reinstalling gnome-media anyway, maybe it'll add it the way it should be.
Np. Yeah, or just add it to startup programs
